greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest prime of the form (n^k+1)/(n+1), or 0 if no such prime exists.
comment: When n is a power (greater than 2) of a prime, then (n^k+1)/(n+1) will usually be composite for all k, which is the case for n = 8, 27, 32, 64, 125. The next term, a(30), is a 204-digit number. - _T. D. Noe_, Jan 22 2004
link: H. Dubner and T. Granlund, Primes of the Form (b^n+1)/(b+1), J. Integer Sequences, 3 (2000), #P00.2.7.
R. G. Wilson, v, Letter to N. J. A. Sloane, circa 1991.
xref: Cf. A084742 (least k such that (n^k+1)/(n+1) is prime).
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_ and Meenakshi Srikanth (menakan_s(AT)yahoo.com), Jun 15 2003
ext: More terms from _T. D. Noe_, Jan 22 2004
